result.execSummary:
The defendant William Wayne Johnson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Wayne Johnson Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William Wayne Johnson Jr. was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • William Wayne Johnson Jr. was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Concurrent to Pierce County Case #04CF93.
Defendant to sign up for Probation in jail.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Concurrent with: to Pierce County Case #04CF93

miscConds.notes: $268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF12.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Concurrent with: to 04CF93

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent to Pierce County Case.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:
$1379.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #15CF12 (Count 1 - Probation).

Consecutive to Count 1.
With credit for good time.
Consecutive to: to Count 1
AODA and follow any recommended treatment before getting Driver's License back.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  William Wayne Johnson appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:04 p.m.  Attorney Harrelson has asked for a continuance so the DE can get into a treatment facility.   State objects and makes argument.   Sentencing arguments by the attorneys.   DE makes statement.  Crt Orders:  

Ct. 1 & Ct. 3 in 15CF12 to run concurrent with Pierce County case 04CF93

Ct. 1 in 15CF12 
- W/S 2 years probations with conditions
- DE sentenced to 296 days in the St. Croix County Jail (Which began Jan, 12, 2015 through November 1, 2015) 
- 201 days credit for time served
- AODA with follow through and with any recommended treatment
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- $268 Court Costs to be paid through the DOC
- DE to sign up for probation in jail


Ct. 3 in 15CF12 
Ct. 3 is consecutive to Ct. 1
- DE sentenced to 60 days in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for good time
- AODA and any recommended treatment before getting driver's license back
- 12 months driver's license revocation
- 12 months IID
- Court costs of $1,379.00 to be paid through the DOC

- 20 days to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: William Wayne Johnson appeared.  Court called at 4:08 p.m. Set for Motion Hearing.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 & Ct. 3 in 15CF12.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 & Ct. 3 in 15CF12. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF12. Court orders a short form PSI.  Court will schedule SEH after reviewing the PSI.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 4:21 p.m. lw
Defendant's NMM to Dismiss Amended Information filed by Atty Harrelson. eif
